it.polimi.automata

Interface BA<LABEL extends Label,STATE extends State,TRANSITION extends Transition<LABEL>>

  • Type Parameters:
    STATE - is the type of the state of the Buchi Automaton. The type of the states of the automaton must implement the interface State
    TRANSITION - is the type of the transition of the Buchi Automaton. The typer of the transitions of the automaton must implement the interface Transition
    LABEL - is the type of the label of the transitions depending on whether the automaton represents the model or the claim it is a set of proposition or a propositional logic formula Label
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IBA<LABEL,STATE,TRANSITION>, IntersectionBA<LABEL,STATE,TRANSITION>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BAImpl, IBAImpl, IntBAImpl

    public interface BA<LABEL extends Label,STATE extends State,TRANSITION extends Transition<LABEL>>
extends java.lang.Cloneable

    Represents a Buchi Automaton
    The state of the automaton must must implement the State interface
    The transition of the automaton must must implement the Transition interface
    The label of the transition must implement the label interface and depending on whether the automaton represents the model or the claim it is a set of proposition or a propositional logic formula

    Author:
    claudiomenghi

        java.util.Set<TRANSITION> getOutTransitions(STATE state)
        return the set of transitions that exits the state
        Parameters:
        state - is the state under analysis
        Returns:
        the set of transitions that exits the state
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the state is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the state is not contained into the set of state of the Buchi automaton

      • addInitialState

        void addInitialState(STATE state)
        adds the initial state to the Buchi automaton. If the state is not contained into the states of the automaton it is also added to the states of the automaton
        Parameters:
        state - the state to be added as initial state
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the state is null

      • addAcceptState

        void addAcceptState(STATE state)
        adds the accepting state to the Buchi automaton. If the state is not contained into the state of the automaton it is also added to the states of the automaton
        Parameters:
        state - the state to be added as accepting state
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the state is null

      • addState

        void addState(STATE state)
        adds the state to the set of the state of the Buchi automaton. If the state is already present into the set of the states of the automaton no actions are performed
        Parameters:
        state - is the state to be added to the states of the Buchi automaton
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the state to be added is null

      • addCharacter

        void addCharacter(LABEL character)
        adds the character to the characters of the Buchi automaton. If a character is already contained in the set of characters of the Buchi automaton no actions are performed
        Parameters:
        character - the character to be added to the Buchi automaton
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - is generated if the character to be added is null

      • addTransition

        void addTransition(STATE source,
                 STATE destination,
                 TRANSITION transition)
        add the transition t which connects the source and the destination state
        Parameters:
        source - is the source of the transition
        destination - is the destination of the transition
        transition - is the transition to be added
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the source state the destination state or the transition is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - is generated in one of the following cases
        the label of the transition is not contained in the alphabet of the automaton
        the source is not contained into the set of the states of the automaton
        the destination of the transition is not contained into the set of the states of the automaton
        a transition that connect source to the destination is already present

      • removeState

        void removeState(STATE state)
        removes the specified state from the set of the states of the Buchi automaton
        Parameters:
        state - is the state to be removed from the states of the Buchi automaton
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the state to be removed is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the state to be removed is not contained into the set of the states of the Buchi automaton

      • removeTransition

        void removeTransition(TRANSITION transition)
        removes the specified transitions from the set of transitions of the Buchi automaton
        Parameters:
        transition - is the transition to be removed from the transitions of the Buchi automaton
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the transition to be removed is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the transition to be removed is not contained into the set of transitions of the automaton

      • removeAcceptingState

        void removeAcceptingState(STATE state)
        removes the specified state from the set of the accepting states of the Buchi automaton the method does not remove the states from the states of the automaton
        Parameters:
        state - is the accepting state to be removed from the accepting states of the Buchi automaton
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the state to be removed is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the state to be removed is not contained into the set of the accepting states of the Buchi automaton

      • removeInitialState

        void removeInitialState(STATE state)
